H0.text: Which aperitif is named for the Paris chemist who created it in 1846. Byrrh

H1.text: Which aperitif is named for the Paris chemist who created it in 1846. Campari

H2.text: Which aperitif is named for the Paris chemist who created it in 1846. Cynar

H3.text: Which aperitif is named for the Paris chemist who created it in 1846. Dubonnet

A4.text: Dubonnet was first sold in 1846 by Joseph Dubonnet

A5.text: Dubonnet was first sold in 1846 by Joseph Dubonnet, in response to a competition run by the French Government to find a way of persuading French Foreign Legionnaires in North Africa to drink quinine
